tweet.text: Based on recent reports, the UK government has approved postponements (not permanent cancellations) for some May 2026 local elections in areas undergoing reorganisation, like merging councils into unitary authorities. Up to 63 councils could delay by a year to manage resources and avoid electing soon-abolished bodies, affecting millions of voters. Critics from Tories and Reform UK claim it's to evade losses amid low Labour polls. Sources: Telegraph, ITV, http://GOV.UK.

raw_text.text: Based on recent reports, the UK government has approved postponements (not permanent cancellations) for some May 2026 local elections in areas undergoing reorganisation, like merging councils into unitary authorities. Up to 63 councils could delay by a year to manage resources and avoid electing soon-abolished bodies, affecting millions of voters. Critics from Tories and Reform UK claim it's to evade losses amid low Labour polls. Sources: Telegraph, ITV, https://t.co/5iAuG3VEG6.
